description.plain:
Sugarland is a country music duo that was founded in 2002 by Kristen Hall & Kristian Bush .  It became a trio after hiring Jennifer Nettles as lead singer.  Hall left in 2006.

Jennifer Nettles – lead vocals
Kristian Bush – lead and background vocals, mandolin, acoustic guitar, harmonica

Known for “Baby Girl”, “Want To”, “Settlin'”, “All I Want to Do”, “Already Gone”, and “It Happens”.

Awards/Honors:
Academy of Country Music Awards:
2006 Top New Duo or Vocal Group
2008 Song of the Year “Stay”
2008 Single of the Year “Stay”
2009 Top Vocal Duo
2010 Top Vocal Duo
American Music Awards:
2005 Favorite Breakthrough New Artist
Country Music Association Awards:
2007 Vocal Duo of the Year
2008 Vocal Duo of the Year
2008 Song of the Year “Stay”
2009 Vocal Duo of the Year
2010 Vocal Duo of the Year
2011 Vocal Duo of the Year
CMT Music Awards:
2007 Duo Video of the Year “Want To”
2008 Duo Video of the Year “Stay”
2009 Duo Video of the Year “All I Want to Do”
2011 Duo Video of the Year “Stuck Like Glue”
Grammy Awards:
2009 Best Country Performance by a Duo or Group with Vocals “Stay”
2009 Best Country Song “Stay”

songs.title: Babe

description.plain:
“Babe” is a song Taylor Swift wrote with Pat Monahan of Train while working on her 2012 album, Red. The track, which fans believe is about actor Jake Gyllenhaal, finds Taylor looking back on a failed relationship. It’s interesting to note that “Better Man,” a song Taylor gave to Little Big Town in 2017, has very similar themes.

Fans have pointed out several connections between “Babe” and other songs written for the Red album, including “All Too Well,” “Girl At Home,” and “The Last Time.”

songs.embed_content: Read “Babe” by Sugarland on Genius

The track, which fans believe is about actor Jake Gyllenhaal, finds Taylor looking back on a failed relationship. You call, but I won't hear it
You said "No one else"

You really blew this, babe
We ain't gettin' through this one, babe
This is the last time I'll ever call you, babe
This is the last time, this is the last time
This is the last time, I'll ever call you "babe"

[Verse 2: Sugarland]
What a waste
Takin' down the pictures and the plans we made, yeah
And it's strange how your face doesn't look so innocent
Your secret has its consequence and that's on you, babe

We're a wreck, you're the wreckin' ball

How could you do this, babe?

We ain't gettin' through this one, babe
This is the last time I'll ever call you, babe

This is the last time

Since you admitted it (Oh), I keep picturin' (Oh)
Her lips on your neck (Oh), I can't unsee it (Oh)
I hate that because of you (Oh), I can't love you, babe
What a shame, didn't want to be the one that got away

[Chorus: Sugarland & Taylor Swift]
How could you do this, babe?
You really blew this, babe
We ain't gettin' through this one, babe
How could you do this, babe?
This is the last time, this is the last time
This is the last time I'll ever call you, babe

[Outro: Sugarland & Taylor Swift]
How could you do this, babe?
I'm here on the kitchen floor, you call but I won't hear it
You said "No one else," we ain't gettin' through this one, babe
I break down every time you call, this is the last time
We're a wreck, you're the wreckin' ball
This is the last time
You said "No one else"
This is the last time I'll ever call you "babe"12Embed

songs.title: Stay
songs.embed_content: Read “Stay” by Sugarland on Genius
songs.lyrics:
12 ContributorsStay Lyrics[Verse 1]
I've been sittin' here starin' at the clock on the wall
And I've been layin' here prayin', prayin' she won't call
It's just another call from home
And you'll get it and be gone and I'll be cryin'

[Verse 2]
And I'll be beggin' you, baby, beg you not to leave
But I'll be left here waitin' with my heart on my sleeve
Oh, for the next time we'll be here
Seems like a million years and I think I'm dyin'
[Pre-Chorus]
What do I have to do to make you see
She can't love you like me?

[Chorus]
Why don't you stay?
I'm down on my knees
I'm so tired of bein' lonely
Don't I give you what you need?
When she calls you to go
There is one thing you should know
We don't have to live this way
Baby, why don't you stay?

[Verse 3]
You keep tellin' me, baby, there will come a time
When you will leave her arms and forever be in mine
But I don't think that's the truth
And I don't like bein' used and I'm tired of waitin'

[Pre-Chorus]
It's too much pain to have to bear
To love a man you have to share

[Chorus]
Why don't you stay?
I'm down on my knees
I'm so tired of bein' lonely
Don't I give you what you need?
When she calls you to go
There is one thing you should know
We don't have to live this way
Baby, why don't you stay?
You might also like[Bridge]
I can't take it any longer, but my will is gettin' stronger
And I think I know just what I have to do
I can't waste another minute after all that I've put in it
I've given you my best, why does she get the best of you?

[Pre-Chorus]
So next time you find
You wanna leave her bed for mine

[Chorus]
Why don't you stay?
I'm up off my knees
I'm so tired of bein' lonely
You can't give me what I need
When she begs you not to go
There is one thing you should know
I don't have to live this way
Baby, why don't you stay, yeah?
Oh-oh, oh-oh, oh-oh-oh, oh3Embed

songs.title: Still the Same

description.plain:
After spending time to pursue their own solo music careers, Sugarland members Jennifer Nettles and Kristian Bush reunite after a six year break with their brand new single, “Still the Same.” The lead single is from their upcoming untitled album, set for release in 2018.

In a recent press release, Sugarland describe the song title as being “meaningful to us as we want fans to know, we are still the same, we are still the same Sugarland they’ve known and loved”.

songs.embed_content: Read “Still the Same” by Sugarland on Genius

songs.lyrics:
10 ContributorsStill the Same Lyrics[Verse 1]
Where do we start?
How 'bout right here where we are?
You've been carryin' this weight around
Walk in the door and lay it down
Life goes fast

Where have you been? How did that feel?
Where are we now? 'Cause that's what's real, yeah

Man, you should have seen us
This ain't no mystery

[Chorus]

To leave it better than how it came

Let's leave it better than how it came
Don't be afraid to change
Our love is still the same, still the same, still the same

To leave it better than how it came
Don't be afraid to change
Our love is still the same, still the same, still the same

And we can see, don't have to be

Take a breath, let it happen
When I hear you laugh
It sets me free, it sets me free

[Chorus]
I feel alive, and can we try
To leave it better than how it came
Don't be afraid to change
Our love is still the same, still the same, still the same
And here we are (here we are), we've come so far

Don't be afraid to change
